clinical_study.brief_title: Impact of the Implementation of a Clinical Pharmacy Bundle on Intensive Care Unit Patient Outcomes and Cost Expenditures
clinical_study.official_title: Impact of the Implementation of a Clinical Pharmacy Bundle on Intensive Care Unit Patient Outcomes and Cost Expenditures

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of this before-after study was to assess the impact of a clinical pharmacy bundle of care activities on patient outcomes (length of hospital stay as a primary endpoint) and cost expenditure in two French ICUs.

secondary_outcome.measure: Intensive Care Unit length of stay

secondary_outcome.time_frame: End of hospital stay (expected average of 20 days)
End of hospital stay (expected average of 20 days)

other_outcome.measure: The rate of isolation of multidrug resistant organisms
other_outcome.time_frame: End of hospital stay (expected average of 20 days)

arm_group.description: The group of patients was observed between Janary 2013 and December 2013

arm_group.arm_group_label: Period with presence of clinical pharmacist
arm_group.description: The group of patients was observed between January 2014 and June 2015.

study_pop.textblock:
The two study populations are composed of all patients present in the ICU on weekdays.
The first population is composed of patients present between January 2013 and December 2013.
The second population is composed of patients present between January 2014 and June 2015.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Intensive Care Unit patients on weekdays
